sections.name: Alate Ant
sections.text: Alate ants are no less devoted and powerful than red guard ants, but they are slightly smaller in size and have delicate wings that bear them aloft. Alate ants secrete pheromones that addle the minds of the hive's enemies. A hive deploys alate ants as both defenders from aerial threats and as advance scouts.

link.name: Pathfinder #174: Shadows of the Ancients pg. 72
link.alt: Pathfinder #174: Shadows of the Ancients pg. 72

sections.name: Gigantic Ant
sections.text: When the heroes are particularly small, an ordinary red ant can pose an impressive combat challenge. Against high-level heroes, though, simply making a mundane animal very large doesn't usually incorporate the quirks and tricks that make high-level fights so satisfying.

link.name: Pathfinder #174: Shadows of the Ancients pg. 72
link.alt: Pathfinder #174: Shadows of the Ancients pg. 72

link.name: Pathfinder #174: Shadows of the Ancients pg. 72
link.alt: Pathfinder #174: Shadows of the Ancients pg. 72

traits.name: Rare
traits.text: This rarity indicates that a rules element is very difficult to find in the game world. A rare feat, spell, item or the like is available to players only if the GM decides to include it in the game, typically through discovery during play. Creatures with this trait are rare. They typically can't be summoned. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to these creatures is increased by 5.

traits.name: Beast
traits.text: A creature similar to an animal but with an Intelligence modifier of –3 or higher is usually a beast. Unlike an animal, a beast might be able to speak and reason.

link.name: Pathfinder #174: Shadows of the Ancients pg. 72
link.alt: Pathfinder #174: Shadows of the Ancients pg. 72

automatic_abilities.name: Darting Flight
automatic_abilities.trigger: The ant is targeted with  an attack by an attacker it can see
automatic_abilities.effect: The ant gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

traits.name: Finesse
traits.text: You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on attack rolls using this melee weapon. You still use your Strength modifier when calculating damage.

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

traits.name: Finesse
traits.text: You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on attack rolls using this melee weapon. You still use your Strength modifier when calculating damage.

ability.name: Frenzy
ability.effect: The alate ant enters a state of jittery agitation. It becomes quickened for 3 rounds and can use the extra action only to Fly or Strike.

ability.name: Pheromone Spray

traits.name: Emotion
traits.text: This effect alters a creature's emotions. Effects with this trait always have the mental trait as well. Creatures with special training or that have mechanical or artificial intelligence are immune to emotion effects.

traits.name: Enchantment
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the enchantment school of magic, typically involving mind control, emotion alteration, and other mental effects.

traits.name: Mental
traits.text: A mental effect can alter the target's mind. It has no effect on an object or a mindless creature.

ability.text: The alate ant sprays a cloud of pheromones in a 15-foot cone. Non-ant creatures in the cone must succeed at a DC 37 Will save or become confused for 1d4 rounds (1 minute on a critical failure). It can't use Pheromone Spray again for 1d4 rounds.

ability.name: Pack Attack
ability.text: The alate ant deals an additional 3d6 precision damage to any creature within reach of at least two of the ant's allies.

affliction.name: Red Ant Venom

traits.name: Poison
traits.text: An effect with this trait delivers a poison or deals poison damage. An item with this trait is poisonous and might cause an affliction.

affliction.text: While a creature is enfeebled from this poison, it is confused (this confusion is an emotion, enchantment, and mental effect)
